newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK stocks seen range-bound in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks seen range-bound in quiet trade.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are expected to consolidate within a tight range on Friday on a lack of fresh incentives, brokers said.

"The market is likely to continue its consolidation in quiet trading ahead of the weekend, and the index will move within a 50-point range today," said Andrew To, dealing director at OSK Asia Securities. Beijing's measures to curb speculation on Chinese stock markets would also affect sentiment, he added.
The Hang Seng Index eased 23.52 points to 14,212.00 on Thursday. Later, the Hang Seng London Reference Index added 11.93 points to 14,223.93.
